'The Larceny Act 1916' was an Act of the Parliament of the United Kingdom. Its
purpose was to consolidate and simplify the law relating to larceny triable on
indictment and to kindred
offences. [http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1916/50/contents/enacted
Larceny Act 1916]

Section 23 provided maximum penalties for a number of offences of robbery and
aggravated robbery.

Section 24 created the offence of sacrilege.

Section 25 created the offence of burglary.

Sections 29 to 31: see blackmail.

Section 32 related to false pretences.
